page.title: 18ASHPERTON CRICKET CLUB
page.content: The club was founded in the 1930's and named the Canon Frome Cricket Club by the founder members. It plays on a ground made available by a local farmer which is tended by members. Players who started with the club as young men, before moving away, travel regularly from Hereford and even Cardiff.The club has been in the first division of the Russel Baldwin and Bright, Hereford and District cricket league since it was founded and has won the championship on three occasions. In the Hereford Times this week they are listed as playing the Luctonians. The club runs two teams and are keen to bring on young players but are concerned that few boys seem to get a good grounding in the game in the secondary schools.
